definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I was invited to a bring-and-buy sale yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我應邀去了一個義賣會。

sentences.english: This year The Gift Bazaar 2011 will be held at the Canadian International School, Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 禮物義賣會將在加拿大國際學校舉辦。

sentences.english: The fete will go ahead provided the rain keeps off.
sentences.chinese: 要是不下雨，義賣會就照常進行。

sentences.english: The fete will take place on Sunday, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 遊園義賣會定於星期日舉行，風雨無阻。

sentences.english: Our church held a fair to raise money for charity.
sentences.chinese: 我們教堂舉辦了一次義賣會爲慈善事業籌款。

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4

definition: to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
Taroko, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Checheng township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
